column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Start an Alternative School
#Text=Maybe you do n't like the education your children are getting .
#Text=Maybe other parents in the area feel the same .
#Text=Sometimes this involves little geniuses that do n't adapt to the lower level kinds of education .

#Text=Or , one may use alternative kinds of education to graduate early from high school using homeschooling , and/or take classes at a junior college while finishing high school -- as ways to advance .

#Text=This may be about children working at or above grade level who are bored -- or , conversely , those below grade level who may be repeating a grade , for one reason or another , without learning anything new .
#Text=Another possibility is that the public school lessons do not go well with your religious or political beliefs .

#Text=If your school does n't offer a special gifted/talented class ( or when you think that 's not good enough ) you can homeschool your child and others ' children , by setting up an private alternative kind of school .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide on a location for your new school .
#Text=For small starters , your living room should do it , but depending on the number of children it may not be practical for you or for them .
#Text=Maybe someone 's garage could be a good option if they do n't own a car or maybe a rented space ( depending on how many children you intend to enroll in the school one room may be enough ) .
#Text=Get the basic supplies .
#Text=These would be for the average classroom a table for each student with a chair ( or maybe a big table with chairs all around ) and a separate desk with chair for the teacher(s) .
#Text=You may want also a bookcase to keep the students ' text books , tests and record their progress and keep their files and worksheets .
#Text=A cork bulletin board for notes ( such as announcements , for field trips and lunch menu , etc. ) and a white/chalk board will also come in handy .
#Text=Write your school plan as you want it to be : consider the schedules for you and the children .
#Text=Think about what subjects you want to teach and who will teach the children if not yourself .

#Text=This wo n't be too hard as it will be most likely the main reason why you are doing this anyway . ~ Add subjects that your children may need and do n't have at regular schools - anything goes , including both religious and secular subjects . ~ Abolish any subjects you do n't find appropriate :

#Text=Many parents do n't want the children to have sex education while they 're quite young . ~ Write the curriculum of studies : consider schedules , and how to make the classes -- or hire someone to do that for you .
#Text=Prepare to start homeschooling :
#Text=make sure everything is in place and ready to work .
#Text=Open for sign ups and sign up your children .
#Text=Check online to Buy Used Homeschool Textbooks .
#Text=Each parent should be aware of how homeschool may be for teenagers or is so beneficial to the young children of parents who share the same religious/political views as you .
#Text=Consider mixed schooling .
#Text=Children may attend public school and attend your school on an extra-curricular basis .
#Text=If this is the most of your students , arrange the schedule of subjects that are n't covered by regular schools so you need to know the time when these children can be there .
#Text=Explain how it differs from the regular schools , and why that is so much better .
#Text=One may want to get out of and beyond the " special accommodations " in public school class .

#Text=That school must teach so that programs for the gifted and talented or exceptional ( called GATE , G/T , or TAG ) " accommodate " the below grade-level , physically or scholastically disabled students ( hearing , visually or learning handicapped ) to include Special Education students .
#Text=Interview the parents to find volunteers : coach , science or mathematics specialist who may help with those assignments doing some or all of the teaching in certain topics .
#Text=Find out when and how often ( one day a week , or 2 or 3 evenings ) they would be able to assist , and what expenses may warrant charging a fee for such classes .
#Text=Tips

#Text=Special education students - those having special individual programs legally may not be " excluded " from attempting G/T classes , if parents insist on putting them in such education with individual ARD - Admission , Review , and Dismissal process and Individualized Education Program ( IEP ) processes which implement the ( IEP ) developed for that student in special education which provides rights and responsibilities in the process for children perhaps working below grade level , ( but they may earn an " A " while working at grade levels well below the regular education goal ) and actually not receiving much in the way of learning accommodations which are stated on paper , that the regular teacher tries implement .
#Text=Check the legal standing and obligations and to Make a Good Impression when You 're Homeschooled in your state or nation .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Your may want or need to Hide the Fact That You Were Homeschooled for reasons of privacy -- or to avoid discrimination .
